page.title: 01SUBURBS OF MIDDLESBROUGH
page.content: The area on the south side of Middlesbrough,at a distance of 2 to 3 miles from the city centre,is largely given over to housing.There are also many schools and recreation grounds. The types of houses are varied : generally speaking,at this distance from the town centre they are fairly spaciously laid out;many have attractive gardens,some containing mature trees.The houses were built at different times over the last 100 years: there are a few cottages,some Victorian suburban villas,streets dating from the 20's,30's,50's _ and some new houses being built today. The primary schools generally stand alone,but the secondary schools are often grouped in twos or threes on campuses on the southern edge of the area, e.g. the schools on Acklam Base.
